title: Thursday, 22nd December, 2016
bodyHTML:
11:03 am

undefined

BE11:06am

PM11:07am

Actually there is one piece of news

Concerning...

PM11:07am

PM11:08am

11:08 am

PM11:08am

11:08 am

PM11:09am

Because the LTIP numbers are completely ordinary and deserved

PM11:09am

http://www.investe...1612220700105559S/

PM11:09am

PM11:09am

I think the board of easyjet are dicing here

11:09 am
PM11:09am

Is that really enough to keep Caroline?

PM11:10am

I'm not so sure

PM11:10am

Weren't they warned about this -- the risk here?

11:10 am
easyJet plc (EZJ:LSE): Last: 1,027, down 1 (-0.10%), High: 1,031, Low: 1,021, Volume: 272.72k
BE11:10am

I mean, 40% value destruction in 12 months deserves some kind of recognition ..............

BE11:11am

This was one of my favourite stories of the year: https://www.bloomb...-hang-on-to-mccall

11:11 am
BE11:12am

The EasyJet board wants to make pay goals more achievable amid concerns that McCall and her team may be lured to other companies as aviation bears the brunt of economic and political uncertainty, according to the people, who asked not to be named as the proposals haven’t been made public.

BE11:12am

Aye.

PM11:12am

Well the performance targets are set out in that link above

11:12 am
undefined
PM11:13am

What else?

BE11:13am

I dunno, I'm still stuck on the thought that, if Ryanair falls 4% on the year and EasyJet's down 40%, am I right or wrong to suggest management of the latter might've done things differently?

11:13 am
BE11:13am

Anyway.............

PM11:13am

Lotte Shopping has Q3s out

PM11:13am

http://www.investe...1612220700055561S/

BE11:14am

Who?

PM11:14am

South Korean grocer

PM11:14am

Listed in korea

11:14 am
PM11:14am

BE11:14am

Oh, that Lotte Shopping.

BE11:14am

(@littleclenches: feel free to name one.)

11:15 am
PM11:15am

We've also got performance guidance out from Global Invacom Group

PM11:15am

Otherwise known as a losses warning

PM11:15am

http://www.investe...1612220700074797S/

11:16 am
PM11:16am

This is primarily due to the Group's consolidation of its manufacturing operations in the People's Republic of China, as announced on 8 November 2016.

The Group will incur one-off shutdown expenses of approximately US$3.0 million for the closure and cessation of Radiance Electronics (Shenzhen) Co., Ltd.

Global Invacom Group Ltd (GINV:LSE): Last: 8.50, no change, Volume: 0.00
BE11:16am

The Christmas shutdown does lead us to some very odd places. Global Invacom Group?

11:17 am
BE11:17am

Oh, it does space junk.

BE11:18am

Want to move up among the companies that actually, y'know, have some name recognition?

PM11:18am

If we must

11:18 am
undefined
BE11:18am

There's ITV. Which also does space junk, albeit it's broadcast space.

PM11:04am

I'm not actually late

11:18 am
BE11:19am

Macquarie's keen.

BE11:19am

Expect to read this note a lot in tomorrow's market reports, as it's literally the only bit of directional sellside that's been pubbed today.

BE11:20am

After years of deflation, the trend in UK retail prices is improving and suggests a return to above-the-line ad spending in the consumer goods sector which represents c.30% of total ad spending. We expect ITV NARs to trough in Q1 with improving trends in the second part of the year. We upgrade to Outperform with a 220p target price (takeover valuation would be 300p).

11:20 am
BE11:20am

The main leading indicator we follow for advertising spending has turned supportive again in the UK. The signal is not strong in absolute terms, but it seems to suggest a potential improvement from our/consensus estimates of - 5% NARs in 2017. Exporters’ optimism on the back of a weaker pound boosted business confidence shortly after the initial Brexit shock, though that is unlikely to translate in much domestic advertising spending. Our view builds on improved trends for the UK consumer goods sector.

BE11:21am

The competition between traditional retailers and discounters in the UK seems to have reached an equilibrium. The results of our proprietary survey (link here) show that consumers are “numb” to price message: 1) two-thirds of respondents don’t seem to have noticed the price war; and 2) 42% of consumers wouldn’t switch anyway.

BE11:21am

.... Yes, we're talking about grocery's phony price war in the middle of a media note ....

11:21 am
BE11:22am

... just to cover both bases simultaneously.

BE11:22am

The increase in the retail price of bananas (including Aldi and Lidl) a few weeks ago is a case in point. A similar increase in the price of milk by discounters is also supportive of some retail price inflation with anecdotal evidence that manufacturers are pushing for price hikes beyond the pure increase in input costs due to a weaker pound (e.g. Marmitegate, see below). In this framework, we argue that a shift towards above-the-line marketing spending – as opposed to promotions - is inevitable. And the consumer goods sector is the largest for ad spending (c30% of total ad spending).

BE11:22am

I have, to my recollection, never seen media analysis reference the price of bananas.

11:23 am
BE11:23am

Well done analyst Giasone Salati for breaking new ground.

PM11:23am

indeed

BE11:24am

We have made minor adjustments to 2016-17 estimates (lower non advertising revenues) and increased NAR growth in 2018 to 6%. The net impact is a 1% rise on average to our EPS 2016-18E.

11:24 am
PM11:25am

Giasone just recently joined Macquarie

PM11:25am

Ex Redburn --

BE11:26am

(@littleclenches: Pindar. famously, take a very low wage and earns everything on the performance bonus. I don't know off the top of my head what the metric is there, but if he's on good money for this year I'd argue that it's the metric that was wrong.)

11:26 am
BE11:26am

Ag. Here's a bit more.

BE11:26am

ITV ranks poorly in our Quant Alpha model (249/347), due to negative price and earnings momentum, but a reversal of the downward trend in advertising would boost the rating. Our DCF-based target price increase to 220p from 170p reflecting the improved mid-term prospects for advertising revenues. We upgrade to Outperform from Neutral.

BE11:27am

Based on 14x EBITDA, the avg historical transaction multiple for FTA assets and the same we use to set the €4 TP for Mediaset (MS IM, €4.54 Outperform), we see a takeover valuation of 300p - John Malone owns 10% via Liberty Global and ITV has widely been reported in the press as a takeover target.

11:27 am
BE11:28am

Seen the artwork in the lobby of Liberty's London office, incidentally? It's horrible. Like a dirty protest.

undefined
BE11:28am

Two! Minutes! Left! of! 2016! ML!

11:28 am
PM11:29am

And nothing to fill

BE11:29am

(@littleclenches: good point! I'm half asleep. Apologies.)

BE11:29am

There's CS taking profit in Sky.

11:29 am
PM11:29am

Actually i could encourage you to read Lisa P -- which will be up on the site in a minute or two

BE11:29am

Yes, do read that.

BE11:30am

In the meantime, here's that Sky note.

11:30 am
PM11:30am

Sorry -- go on on Sky

BE11:30am

Which'll help pad out the arbs' midday summaries, if nothing else.

BE11:30am

We downgrade to Neutral post 21 st Century Fox offer: We downgrade our
rating on Sky to Neutral from Outperform post the formal offer from 21 st
Century Fox for the share capital it does not already own. We raise our target
price to 1075p, in-line with the offer price, up from our previous TP of 980p.
Potential upside of c.9% at some point within a 12 month time frame is
insufficient to maintain an Outperform rating, given regulatory risk and
uncertainty (even if risk is relatively low in our view).

11:30 am
BE11:30am

Regulatory timeline will take centre stage: Fox has indicated the proposed
transaction could take up to one year to close including getting EU/UK
regulatory approvals and shareholder approval via a scheme of arrangement.
Fox has reserved the right to proceed via an offer rather than a scheme and
has agreed a GBP200m break fee. The companies have agreed that Sky will
pay no dividends in 2017, but can pay dividends in 2018, including a 10p
special dividend if the transaction is not closed by the end of 2017.

BE11:31am

Catalysts and Risks: The proposed transaction will need EU merger
clearance. This could theoretically go to Phase 1 or Phase 2 but in our view it
is likely to gain merger clearance without major conditions given the lack of
overlap in Europe between the two companies. There could also be a referral
to Ofcom under the Enterprise Act 2002 by the Secretary of State for Culture,
Karen Bradley, to look at issues regarding media plurality. Such a referral, is
by no means a certainty but a decision not to refer is potentially subject to
judicial review. Ofcom could also look at the issue of “fit and proper” for
holders of broadcasting licences under the Broadcasting Act 1990 (source:
Guardian 14th December 2016).

BE11:31am

Valuation: Our TP is based on the formal offer of 1075p per share by Fox.
Based on our estimates 1075p implies EV/EBITDA of 11.0x in calendar
FY17E and 9.7x in FY18E. For free cashflow yield it implies 4.6% in FY17E
and 6.0% in FY18E

(@SOS: in common with all AV competition prizes, it's a matter of some controversy whether it's ever actually awarded.)
